intro: Plagiogyria stenoptera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved plagiogyria, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Plagiogyria stenoptera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
